chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leslie Jean Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
  All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations added to payment plan $35 per month beginning 7/5/17

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
Complete a psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  Not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting,meeting, or in a correctional setting.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
  NO CONTACT with David Stone Jr.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment within 30 days and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Credit for Time Served to be determined.
Granted Work Release and Family Care Release.
Report to Ashland County Jail within 7 days to set up time to begin serving sentence.

Defendant Leslie Jean Stone in court with attorney Daniel W Linehan.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF217,16CF105,16CF246,16CF247.  DA comments - agreement in all cases, Back on record. Rec'd PQ and waiver of rights form and option 2 of the offer to settle is the agreement of the parties. Understands these 4 charges. PLEADS G.  15CF217- count 2, 16CF105 Counts 3,5, 16CF246 Counts 1-4,6 and 16CF247 COunt 2 all DRI. Signed PQ, Understands elements of each crime. Wants Court to accept pleas of G. Ct accepts pleas and finds G. DA comments prior record. Wants court to accept agreement. 1 year probation on case 16CF246.. only mism count. Atty comments- Has been in TAD program, Wants Ct to accept recommendation. Def comments helping daughter with her kids. Drugs are causing a problem with the community.  Ct orders-- See offer to settle. DA comments- does not agree with sentence credit sheet- Credit is TBD-- Ct will communicate with jail to see what credit will be. Will not get double credit. Gets disability payments-- Set paytplan Current- $35 per month- July 5 next payment..

April Linkin.
